text: Simon Robert Naali (March 9, 1966 - August 13, 1994) was a Tanzanian marathon runner. He finished eleventh at the 1993 World Championships in 2:19:30 hours. In addition he won the bronze medal at the 1990 Commonwealth Games. He competed at the 1992 Summer Olympics, where he didn't finish the race. He died in 1994, aged 28 in Moshi, Kilimanjaro, while recovering from injuries suffered in a hit-and-run accident in Tanzania. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1989 |Honolulu Marathon |Honolulu, Hawaii |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:11:47 |- |rowspan=3|1990 |Commonwealth Games |Auckland, New Zealand |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Marathon |2:10:38 |- |Stockholm Marathon |Stockholm, Sweden |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:13:04 |- |Honolulu Marathon |Honolulu, Hawaii |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:17:29 |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |-- |Marathon |DNF |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |11th |Marathon |2:19:30 |} ==References== ==External links== * *sports-reference Category:1966 births Category:1994 deaths Category:Tanzanian male marathon runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Tanzania Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1990 Commonwealth Games Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for Tanzania Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in athletics Category:Road incident deaths in Tanzania Category:Tanzanian male long-distance runners
title: Simon Robert Naali
